body:
Comment 10: 
While Go supports UTF-8, it appears that Google Code's email response reader does not.
Let me try once more:

I do not speak Japanese or Chinese. I took that word from the title of Rob and Ken's
paper http://plan9.bell-labs.com/sys/doc/utf.html, where it is part of the larger phrase
こんにちは 世界, which I believe to be Japanese. From some research it appears
that 世界 means world in both Chinese and Japanese, while こんにちは is
unambiguously Japanese. By using only part of the phrase I introduced the ambiguity.

http://www.google.com/search?q=chinese+word+for+world
http://www.google.com/search?q=japanese+word+for+world

So I think the video is correct as written. If I were recording it again I would say
"Chinese or Japanese" or else change the example. But I don't believe I have the
original screencast source file anymore.

I apologize for any offense.
